pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.3.1: According to [Sp.2.621]() this means repeatedly breaking pieces off a ball of food. The word _avacchedaka_, is further explained at [Vin-vn-ṭ.1920]() as _chinditvā_, “having broken off”. This, it seems, can only refer to breaking off pieces, not to biting.
pli-tv-bu-vb-sk45:1.11: _Khajjaka_. According to [Sp.2.615]() this refers to all non-staple foods: _Ettha mūlakhādanīyādi sabbaṁ gahetabbaṁ_, “Here the non-staple foods which are roots, etc. may all be taken.”
